intro: Centaurea giardinae, commonly known as the Garden Centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are bright yellow with a central disk, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea giardinae is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
